article:
Enid's wedding dress arrived at five o'clock in the evening, just seventeen  _  before her marriage!
"I must try it on, Mother!" she cried, as she ran  upstairs   .Three minutes later Enid's cries brought her  _  .The dress was much   too big   for her. It was like a bag in the front, and the neckline  looked all   _  . Enid was in  _  . 
"Take it back to the dressmaker's," Mrs Bale said. "She must  _  it tonight. Hurry now. Take it off and go." The dressmaker's shop was closed. "Closed for One Week's Holiday," said a  _  on the door. Fresh tears rose to Enid's eyes. She ran home again to her mother.
"This is unlucky," Mrs Bale said." But what are we going to do?  _  I ask Mrs. Peters to help? She was a dressmaker once. I'm sure she could change it for you."
Mrs. Peters was45 _ in and began to work. She could see  _  was wrong. She had to  _  it narrower at the front, and that was a big job. Then she changed the neckline. In fact she made it again. At ten o'clock the work was finished, and Enid tried the dress on. It fitted her beautifully.
The three women were having a cup of tea   _   the doorbell rang .Mrs. Bale answered it and   _   into the worried eyes of a   fat young  woman. The woman was carrying a large flat  _  .
"Does Miss Enid Bale   _   here?" she asked breathlessly. "Yes, she's my daughter." "Oh, I am   _   I've found you! There's been a   _  .Your daughter has my wedding dress, and I've got  hers  . And I'm getting married tomorrow!" She held out the box to Mrs. Bale.
